Migrants piloting small boats across Channel are increasingly being prosecuted
subhead: Are they simply asylum seekers or accomplices of smugglers? Those who agree to take the helm of boats in exchange for a reduced crossing price are accused of aiding illegal immigration and even involuntary manslaughter.

Inequality on the rise in France amid a staggering surge in income among the ultrarich
subhead: The wealthiest 0.1% of French people earn, on average, 167 times more than the quarter of households with the lowest incomes, according to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies. The gap has widened dramatically over the past 20 years, while reforms introduced by Emmanuel Macron have reduced the tax rate for the richest households.

title: Should Vinted, Temu or Amazon really be regulated like pornographic platforms?
subhead: By applying legislation designed for adult websites to online marketplaces, the government is fighting the wrong battle, unless the goal is to ban the entire internet for minors.

title: 'Eleanor the Great': Scarlett Johansson's successful directorial debut
subhead: The actress directs the story of an initially harmless lie of an old woman who usurps the story of a deceased friend who survived a concentration camp after being deported.

title: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.

'We're all afraid': Marseille community buries anti-drug activist's murdered brother
subhead: The burial of Mehdi Kessaci took place on Tuesday, under heavy police protection. While displaying a spirit of resistance, those who dared to condemn drug trafficking admitted to being paralyzed by this killing.

title: COP30 presents an existential issue for Indigenous peoples
subhead: The global climate conference was meant to be a moment of recognition for Indigenous peoples, who have been placed at the heart of President Lula's political agenda. Yet, faced with the Brazilian president's contradictions, Indigenous activists have come to the fore, determined to make their voices heard at a summit that directly affects them.

title: Lady Gaga transforms into a larger-than-life Shakespearean heroine
